intro: Carya porcina var. acuta, commonly known as the prickly pear hickory, is a deciduous tree native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the walnut family (Juglandaceae) and is characterized by its thorny branches and edible nuts. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a serrated margin. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in spring, followed by spiny, woody fruits that mature in the fall. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and historical contexts.
